channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report I-2023090136
item.description:
Report I-2023090136

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-13
  • City: Elizabeth
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DHL EXPRESS (USA), INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 09/13/2023 hidden dangerous goods were discovered during the shipment inspection process at the DHL ELZ service center, 15-31 Papetti Plaza, Elizabeth NJ 07206. Transportation by road has been confirmed. Shipment also contains ^ UN3266, Corrosive liquid, basic, inorganic, n.o.s., Class 8 Single Package or Inner Packaging(if any): Packaging Type: Bottle Material ofConstruction: Plastic Package Capacity: 458 mi Amount in Package: 458 mi Number in Shipment 2 Number Failed: 2

item.title: Report X-2023090673
item.description:
Report X-2023090673

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-11
  • City: TRENTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipping box torn while in transit causing three of four Noble Low Temp Sanitizer bottles to have loose caps. Package placed in RED Tote upon discovery and brought to HAZMAT Cage for further processing. DescribePack: Shipping box torn while in transit causing three of four Noble Low Temp Sanitizer bottles to have loose caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in RED Tote upon discovery and brought to HAZMAT Cage for further processing.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipping box fell off Tugger Cart while in transit to Van Line causing one of four Sigma-Aldrich 34998-4L glass bottles to break. Package was immediately placed in RED Tote and brought to HAZMAT Cage for further processing. DescribePack: Shipping box fell off Tugger Cart while in transit to Van Line causing one of four Sigma-Aldrich 34998-4L glass bottles to break. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately placed in RED Tote and brought to HAZMAT Cage for further processing.

item.title: Report X-2023090618
item.description:
Report X-2023090618

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-07
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: IT APPEARS THE SHIPMENT WAS REMOVED FROM SYSTEM FLOW, DUE TO EXTERNAL CARTON BEING TORN AND WET DURING THE DAY SORT. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS DURING THE TWILIGHT SHIFT 4X5 LITERS (PLASTIC BOTTLES) ECOTEMP PART B AND PART A RAPICIDE PA HIGH LEVEL DISINFECTANT FROM MEDIVATORS , PART B BOTTLES 2-5 LITERS HAD LOOSE CAPS WITH CAUSED LEAKAGE. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2023090507
item.description:
Report X-2023090507

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-04T18:16:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-05
  • City: DOVER
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found in dump chute in warehouse, very wet/leaking & torn open. Line manager removed package from dump chute and placed into a red hazmat bin lined with a plastic hazmat bag. Manager brought package to back QA cage for inspection. DescribePack: Package was very wet/leaking. Box was torn open in places, but closures had also come open without tearing. Outer package does not appear punctured. Appears that the liquid leaking from inner bottles as well as the combined weight of these bottles within the package caused package to tear open. Package is an undeclared hazmat. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: When discovered, package was immediately placed into a lined hazmat bin. Leak in dump chute was cleaned with disposable absorbent cloth towels. Gloves worn while cleaning.
